transcripts.text: Really?  Wow.

I'm Ami Horowitz, and Democrats will have you believe that President Trump is a raging racist and Joe Biden is a champion of the Black community.  Well, I'm here in Harlem to find out by playing America's favorite game, Is This Racist?  So I hit the streets to find some Biden-supporting Democrats to play the game.  Let's go.  The game is this.  I'm going to give you a quote, and you're going to tell me how racist that quote is from 10 being most racist, one being least racist.
I've been around.  I went to an all-white high school, so I'm ready for this.
Referring to Barack Obama, he said, first mainstream African-American who is bright, articulate, and clean.  How racist.
Who is bright, articulate, and clean.  10.
Yeah, that's up there.  That's got to be like a 10, a 9.  Yeah.  Because it's like you're implying that most black people, most African-Americans aren't that way.
That was just like, you know, moderate racism.
Oh, it's kind of racist.  I would say probably 9.

Just because somebody is articulate and clean and they happen to be black.  You know, that's not a reason to say it like that.  So, you know, I would say that on a scale of... On a racist-o-meter.  That was a seven.
A seven.
So still racist, but not crazy racist.  Yeah, not crazy, like, not huge.
Say, that's like a nine.
That's a nine.  That's a nine.  That's a nine.  She said, if you don't vote for me talking about black people, then you ain't black.
That's 10.
If you don't vote for me, you're not black.
I'm going to say that that one is definitely not as high as the other one.  Okay.
It's definitely up there.  Yeah.
But I would say that's like a 6.7.
A 6.7.  6.5.  6.5.  I like that.  I like the accuracy on that.  Yeah.  The exactitude.
At first, someone to imply that is a bit like, who are you to tell me if I'm black or not?  So, yeah, I'd say that's about a 10.
I'm going to give that an 8.

An 8.  This is a dumbass comment, man.  Referring to inner city busing, bringing black people to white schools, he said that would create a racial jungle.  I don't want my kids going to a racial jungle.  How racist is that?  By doing that, you're creating racial jungles.  And I don't want my children going to a racial jungle.
That's a 10.  Off the bat.  I was bused.  I understand that.  That's a 10.
Straight up.  Straight up.  I would say 10.
That's a reader racist quote.
Yeah.

That's 100% true.
It is.  So not a racist statement?
Not a racist statement at all.
You're living in poverty and your schools are no good.  Is that a racist statement?  No.
Not whatsoever.  I would say probably one.
That's true.  See, these are facts.  So you can't put in a racist category because he's stating something that's really basically facts.
Our inner cities are a disaster.  Is that a racist statement?
Saying that, but it's not racist.  I would say probably two.  Okay.

she won't let you know i couldn't.  it's just like i don't know if i'm not going to open democratic you would expect that when you represent that party, you wouldn't feel comfortable saying things like that in the open and on media. Everybody knows that Joe Biden is racist.  Does everybody know that?  I think you should know that Joe Biden ran three times for president and he's racist.  He never won unless it was an actual black person on his ticket.

Definitely.  Definitely.

100%.  They want our vote, but it's not nothing being done to make a difference as far as the conditions and the changes that we really need.  It goes to a deaf ear.  It's like nobody's listening to what needs to be done.
I feel like they come in and do a photo op and try to highlight it instead of really fixing the issue.  Because later on down the line, you get an office, you turn your back on us.
Of course, everything has always been for years.

I'm going to be honest with you.  I genuinely feel that way. Black people are like, yeah, and then it's like as soon as, you know, the vote's done and you have it, it's like you drop us like a hot sack of potatoes and you just like walk away from us.  It's like you don't do anything for our communities.  You don't do anything for like us in general.

Most of the time, they don't do what they're supposed to do for black people.  So it's like no matter what, they're going to vote for us anyway because that's how we're conditioned to vote for Democrats.
